column1: The '''Barrowfield''' was a field outside the wall and dike of [[Edoras]] where the [[Kings of Rohan
column2: Rulers of Rohan]] were buried. By the end of the [[Third Age]] there were two rows of tombs: one for the First Line ([[Eorl]] to [[Helm
column3: Helm Hammerhand]]) and one for the Second Line ([[Fréaláf]] to [[Théoden]]). The main road leading to the city passed between these two rows.<ref>{{TT

column1: [[Simbelmynë]] grew on the western side of the mounds, and more thickly on Helm's.<ref>{{App
It is not known if the Kings of the Third Line (starting with [[Éomer]]) were still buried there during the [[Fourth Age]].
The name means "a field containing a grave-mound".<ref name="Nomen">{{HM
